name: Hampton Inn & Suites Savannah Midtown

reviews.text: The hotel is brand new, so everything is modern and up to date. I was disappointed to find out how far from the Historic District it was. It's about a $12 taxi fare each way. There is literally nothing in the area to do, so you have to head to the Historic District for dining, attractions, etc. Also, the room didn't have a refrigerator or a microwave and the majority of the desk staff were less than helpful. One gentleman was very helpful, so I guess it's just luck.
reviews.title: Ok, but not the best location...

reviews.text: All in all, it is truly a 3 star experience.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and well furnished. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Great 5 days!

reviews.text: I found this hotel by doing a search through TripAdvisor. I have to say I was quite surprised with all the amenities we had. We were visiting Savannah for 4 days and we decided on this hotel for several reasons: 1) AARP discount was sizeable and made staying there affordable, 2) I'm a Hilton Rewards member, 3) it was right outside of downtown Savannah where hotels charge for parking, 4) parking was free, 5) there was a Concierge service to book our tours, 6)breakfast and Internet was included.
reviews.title: New. Clean, Friendly

reviews.text: The whole facility was clean and bed-bug free. When we asked for extra towels, they were delivered to us in a manner of minutes. The staff was very friendly and always offering us help and directions to where we wanted to go. The lobby was great and there was a large bar area where one could connect their lap top and work while drinking a cup of coffee. The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms were clean and modern. We had an end room so we entered through a hallway which gave us the feeling of living in a Studio apartment.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, super comfortable bed, large bathroom, desk, sofa, wet bar. Couldn't get much better. Quiet location about 4 miles from downtown historic district...and easy drive. Across the street from Bonefish Grille. Respectable buffet breakfast. Wonderful staff. Great rate, too. Free, secure parking. What more could you ask for ?
reviews.title: Perfect stay in midtown Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Very Clean and Comfortable Hotel - A Good Value

reviews.text: - Very clean, bright and comfortable rooms.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: - Comfortable beds with washed duvet covers.
reviews.title: Great place for families

reviews.text: - Free wi-fi in the room.
reviews.title: Hotel CANCELS reservation DAY of arrival.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely property - perfect in every way except it is just too far from the historic distric which is apparently where EVERYTHING is in Savannah! This place is immaculate, beautiful, spotless rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great breakfast, covered, free parking. Really a good value - except we are walkers - we walk everywhere and there is honeslty no place to walk unless you like shopping centers. They told us it is only 3 miles from the Historic district but it takes about 15 minutes to drive there, and it is not an easy drive with all of the squares and the traffic. We actually inquired about staying in the Hampton in the historic distric which was considerably more expensive than this one, but they (as well as ALL of the hotels) were booked solid. It was HOT when we were there, and one evening we sat by the outside pool at the Hilton next door which was very nice. The Hampton has an indoor pool which looked very nice, but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Too far from the good stuff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great, one of the nicest Hamptons we've seen. We are Hampton loyal and have stayed at Hamptons for years while driving back and forth to Florida. This is a warning for those with allergies. it appears Hampton is liberally spraying the rooms with a caustic fragrance. Although they were kind enough to bring up a machine to try to neutralize the odor, upon turning in for the night I discovered my bed sheets were also liberally sprayed with this " deodorizer". There followed a sleepless night of burning eyes and throat. I will have to switch to another brand of hotel if this is Hampton's new system. They are obviously out of the loop when it comes to customer comfort in this area. staff, amenities,etc were all otherwise good. I just can't possibly stay in a smelly room.
reviews.title: All good except the smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently visited Savannah, Georgia and did not want to stay right in the Historic District of Savannah so we chose this Hampton Inn just outside of town. It is a great location and there is a parking garage for your car right next to the hotel. We have stayed at many Hampton's and this one did not disappoint. The staff was very helpful made sure we had a room on a lower floor as requested. The breakfast is a real plus. We were very happy with our choice!
reviews.title: Away from the Savannah hustle and bustle!

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our weekend trip to Savannah! We arrived on Thursday and left on Sunday, and were very happy with our stay. If you don't have a vehicle and don't want to rely on any type of public transportation to get to Historic Downtown, this may not be the hotel for you -- but if you have your own ride, this is just about the perfect place! Safe area, FREE PARKING, and lots of standard restaurants and shopping nearby. If you plan to visit the Historic District, parking is reasonable there -- or if you go on a tour, I know at least Oglethorpe offers free parking if you take their tour and use their shuttles throughout the day.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: So the location is nice, they offer free parking, and they also have a free continental breakfast in the morning that is fantastic. They offer more than just pastries and juice!
reviews.title: i had the best time ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, along with 10 others, during April 2012 as part of a 17 day road trip across GA, NC, SC. By giving the star rating I am not saying the hotel is a 5 star but whether it was clean and value for the money and to an extent we have compared then to the other 10 hotels we stayed at.
reviews.title: Good quality

reviews.text: Unlike some others this Hampton was more like a traditional hotel hotel were you park as near the reception as possible and take your luggage through the reception to a lift to your room. This felt much safer to us than the motel types were your room door is accessible to all from the street.
reviews.title: Good but brief stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated room 526 which was had 2 queen sized beds. With all the furniture in the room, 2 beds, chaise-lounge, desk & chair, TV stand, another desk it was pretty cramped but nothing dire. It may be worth paying the extra £10-£15 for king suite.
reviews.title: Great Price just a few short miles from Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was top notch for cleanliness and standard of furnishings. Clean towels and lots of hot water. No fridge or microwave which suited me (less noise).
reviews.title: Enjoyed our 4-day stay

reviews.text: The included breakfast was pretty good with the offering of cereal, toast, waffles, fruit, yogurt and coffee but also scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage (turkey ones!!!) and proper OJ. The coffee was on tap 24/7 and my missus developed a taste for the decaff with French vanilla cream (like stuff).
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel Away From the Touristy Historic District

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Savannah Midtown Hotel
